issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Here's how to reproduce:

$ mvn site site:stage -DskipTests -DskipTest -DskipITs

comments.body: Thanks for pointing out Roman. I think thats my change on MAPREDUCE-3774. Should be a simple fix. Will upload a patch.
This should fix it. It fixes the site.xml that points to the wrong yarn-default.xml as well.
Looks good to me. Can this be committed?

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12513100/MAPREDUCE-3791.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +0 tests included.  The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

    -1 patch.  The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1774//console

This message is automatically generated.
Thanks for verifying Roman. Committing this now.

Integrated in Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit #1731 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit/1731/])
    MAPREDUCE-3791. can't build site in hadoop-yarn-server-common. (mahadev)

mahadev : http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1240587
